Yesterday was National Children's Mental Health Awareness Day--- North Daviess teachers and staff showed their support by wearing green to fight the stigma associated with mental illness!
Why green? During the 1800's, the color green was used to label individuals that were deemed to be "insane"
Green has since been the color chosen to fight the stigmas associated with mental illness.

Kindergarten Roundup --- 2nd opportunity!

Kindergarten entrance age date has changed!
Indiana has recently changed the Kindergarten entrance age back one month. A child must now be five years old by SEPTEMBER 1. (formerly August 1) Some students who may not have been eligible for our previous Kindergarten Round-up may now be eligible for this fall due to this change. Call 812-636-8000 ext 2000 to schedule your child‚Äôs individual 30-40 minute screening for the week of May 13. Bring birth certificate and shot record to the scheduled appointment. Indiana Law requires children entering school to have the following immunizations: two doses of Hepatitis A vaccine (Hep A), five DTaP, four polio, two doses of MMR (measles, mumps, rubella), three doses of hepatitis B vaccine, and two doses of the Varicella vaccine (or physician-written documentation of chicken pox history including month and year of disease).
